newsitem.title: UK: SOCCER-WIMBLEDON GRANT HOLDSWORTH COMPASSIONATE LEAVE.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-WIMBLEDON GRANT HOLDSWORTH COMPASSIONATE LEAVE.

text.p: Wimbledon striker Dean Holdsworth will miss his team's next two matches after being given compassionate leave by manager Joe Kinnear who has told him to "sort your life out".
Holdsworth, 28, married with two young sons, is at the centre of kiss-and-tell scandal with a busty, teenage soft-porn model. Another teenager has also said she was involved with the player.
And it emerged on Wednesday that Holdsworth was warned about drunkenness by police after being arrested at his home last Sunday.
Holdsworth was arrested for being "drunk and incapable" and for breach of the peace but was released after being given the warning, a police spokesman said.
Holdsworth's wife, Samantha, 28, was awarded a non-molestation order against him at the High Court on Tuesday following the incident, which happened at the family home.

The row came after lurid tabloid allegations that the 5.0 million pounds ($8.5 million) rated player had been having an affair with porn model Linsey Dawn McKenzie and that they had had sex in his wife's car.
A second teenager later said that she had also been romanced by the footballer.
Kinnear said on Wednesday: "Dean's family is more important than football. When I spoke to him it was clear his mind was in turmoil. I have told him to take the time he needs."
Holdsworth has been pulled from the squad for Wednesday night's League Cup quarter-final at Bolton and will also miss Saturday's home league match against Derby.
Holdsworth has been in and out of the Wimbledon side this season and has not started a match since September, although he has been used regularly as a substitute.

Kinnear added: "He asked me if he could have time off to sort out his family life so I've given him a week off. I could have been hard and told him he had to come with us (to Bolton) but I'm showing the boy some compassion.
"He's had a bit of a trauma at the moment and he is very upset. His head is not on football at this time, he's mentally not tuned in. "
